Best Overall

Soft Services Clearing Mist

Pros
  • Easy to apply
  • Refillable packaging
Cons
  • Can take time to see full results

Pavitt’s absolute favorite is the Soft Services Body Spray. “It’s a gentle yet effective body acne treatment featuring one percent salicylic acid and a blend of soothing ingredients,” she says. Plus, zinc PCA and niacinamide help balance sebum production and fade hyperpigmentation, which means the formula prevents acne, fights active spots, and treats whatever’s left behind post-breakout.

Key ingredients: Salicylic acid, niacinamide, zinc PCA

Size: 4 fl. oz.

Soft Services rating: 4.5/5 stars

A Soft Services reviewer says: “I bought this because I was starting to see a lot of body acne from hormonal imbalances in my body. I noticed after just the first night a huge difference in the inflammation and redness, and after regular use, the breakouts were totally gone. My husband also loves using the mist after intense workouts!”

Best Drugstore

Neutrogena Stubborn Body Acne Spray With Salicylic Acid

Cons
  • Mister isn’t as flexible as others

“This spray features two percent salicylic acid and is designed specifically for body acne,” shares Pavitt. “It’s fast-drying, non-greasy, and easy to apply.” The unscented formula can be sprayed on up to three times a day for those with especially resistant breakouts.

Key ingredient: Salicylic acid

Size: 5.5 fl. oz.

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I like to use this on my back, especially in the summer when we get so sweaty here in Texas, where it is unbearably hot. It helps kill bacteria and keep the breakouts away. Wish I had this when I was younger. Sometimes it is tricky to spray it yourself on your back if you cannot keep the bottle upright, but overall, it is fine. Sometimes I will spray it on my hand or cotton and wipe it over areas if needed. I have used it on my face (close your eyes!) and chest as well— buttocks, too.”

Best Quick-Drying

Paula’s Choice Clear Back & Body Exfoliating Acne Spray

Cons
  • Spray not as flexible as others

The Clear Acne Body Spray “is a fan-favorite due to its ease of use (with a 360-degree sprayer and quick-dry formula) and effective blend of two percent salicylic acid with additional skin-soothing agents,” Stordahl says. As a result, it soothes and treats existing breakouts while also preventing future pimples from cropping up.

Key ingredients: Salicylic acid

Size: 4 fl. oz.

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I really really wish I had a good picture of my back from when I was struggling with breakouts. For the past year, I was having issues with my entire back breaking out, so I looked around for something to help it and found this. I used it every day once a day for a few months, and it cleared my back up completely. I will get a bump every now and then, but I haven’t been using it at all anymore since it cleared my back up, and I still haven't had breakouts like I was having.”

Best for Long-Term Benefits

Nécessaire The Body Acne Solution

Powered by salicylic acid, niacinamide, and zinc, this spray-on formula takes care of blemishes, dark spots, and blackheads. The blend also includes rosemary extract, which soothes the skin and has antimicrobial properties, and comes with a 360-degree spray so you can reach every inch of your body with ease.

Key ingredients: Salicylic acid, zinc PCA, niacinamide

Size: 4 fl. oz.

Nécessaire rating: 4.2/5 stars

A Nécessaire reviewer says: “I made a point to come back and write a review on this product. I had recently gotten off of birth control and was breaking out on my back and shoulders for the first time in eight years. They were big, painful, and red. My sister sent me this, and I figured I’d try it out. I genuinely saw my acne calm down within a week. Yes, it was still there, but it was healing! Now, two to three weeks in, my boyfriend is shocked at how much better my back looks. If you are on the fence, try one bottle! Yes, it is a bit sticky, but it doesn’t bother me after I let it fully dry and put clothes on.”

Best Brightening

PanOxyl Acne Banishing Body Spray with 2% Salicylic Acid

Pros
  • 360-degree spray nozzle
Cons
  • Some may dislike scent

PanOxyl makes one of the most popular acne face washes out there, so we had to take a look at the salicylic acid body spray. It’s armed with two percent salicylic acid (the ideal dose, according to our experts), plus brightening vitamin C and soothing aloe.

Key ingredients: Salicylic acid, niacinamide, vitamin C, witch hazel, aloe

Size: 6 fl. oz.

Amazon rating: 4.1/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I had a little breakout on my back this summer, and this stuff cleared it right up! I have super sensitive skin, too. Highly recommend!”

Best Soothing

Dermalogica Clear Start Clarifying Bacne Spray

Cons
  • Some may dislike scents

Excess sebum is one culprit in acne. Dermalogica’s spray combats this by including Moroccan argan oil, a completely non-comedogenic ingredient that soothes irritation and stabilizes the skin’s natural sebum production.

Key ingredients: Salicylic acid, Moroccan argan oil, witch hazel, tea tree oil

Size: 6 fl. oz.

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I’m a late 30s male, prone to bacne when I work out, and I’ve been doing TRT (testosterone shots) since March 2024. Initially had more bacne as a result. Acne [body] wash only helped a little—seemed hopeless. Ordered this spray, and it’s been down 95 percent no joke. Basically doesn’t exist. Definitely the cherry on top to use for successful results. Ordering more!”

Best for Sensitive Skin

Naturium Naturium Salicylic Acid Body Spray 2%

Pros
  • Easy-to-use packaging
Cons
  • Some reviewers reported that nozzle can clog

Naturium prides itself on pH-balanced formulas that are effective but don’t disrupt the skin barrier. In fact, this formula also incorporates a blend of fermented ingredients designed to support the microbiome. Other notable ingredients include hydrating oat protein and brightening alpha-arbutin.

Key ingredients: Salicylic acid, niacinamide, hydrolyzed oat protein, ethyl ascorbic acid, and alpha-arbutin

Size: 4 fl. oz.

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I literally don’t skip a day. I live in humid Florida and get sweat pimples on shoulders, and this has completely gotten rid of it!”

Meet the Experts

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

How should you use salicylic acid body sprays?

Our experts agreed that using it once a day on clean skin is ideal. However, if you have sensitive skin, “start with every other day and gradually increase frequency as your skin builds tolerance,” recommends Pavitt. Meanwhile, if you find that once a day isn’t enough, “ramp up to twice daily (once in the morning, once at night) to get things under control,” says Stordahl.

How do you use salicylic acid body sprays?

You should always spray them onto clean skin, and it’s even better if you’ve just stepped out of a warm shower. “Salicylic acid body sprays can also come in handy for the in-between times, like after a workout when you don’t have access to a shower right away,” Stordahl says. “Sweat mixed with oil and skin-tight workout clothes creates an ideal environment for breakouts, so showering as soon as possible is best, but if you’re unable to do so, spritzing on a salicylic acid body spray can help ward off breakouts in the interim.”

Each time you apply them, you should always let the liquid absorb before putting your clothes on. “Always follow up with a moisturizer to prevent dryness and use sunscreen if you’re applying it to areas exposed to the sun, as salicylic acid can make your skin more sensitive to UV,” Pavitt adds.
